page.title: 18TIMBER GROWING-CONIFERS
page.content: { Newent Woods,}managed by{Huntley {Estates,}covers 400 acres, of which half lie in our block. Planted on red sandstone, the trees are mainly {conifers}such as Douglas Fir,Lawson Cypress,Western Hemrock,Giant Fir, and even Californian Redwood.{Larch, a {deciduous,}is also grown and{Sweet {Chestnut}as the only{hardwood.}Under- planting is not possible because of the dense canopy formed by conifers. There is a 60 year planting/felling cycle on the estate for maximum efficiency. After felling,the smaller material is cut by estate workers into fence posts for local use. The mature timber is sent to saw mills in the area and then on to many outlets. The greatest enemy of the trees is the{grey squirrel,}doing far more damage than disease. There are four permanent employees and two students.
